title: "What is the Method of Acting Naturally and How Does it Affect Personal Development?"
first_phrase: In the final 200 tokens of this text, the concept of "acting naturally" is explored further. It is highlighted that although this mode of acting can be positive or negative, it ultimately serves as a means to an end rather than an end in itself. The author emphasizes the importance of conscious self-presencing and using reason's critique to avoid falling into machine-like behavior. By engaging in healthy rebellion against automatism, individuals can progress towards new and demanding roads.
content: Nevertheless — as we should reiterate once more — “acting naturally” is a means to an end rather than an end in itself. It serves the purpose of diminishing the straining effort necessitated by a voluntary action, though it still depends at all times on a higher level of presencing. The master of his own destiny will always be the conscious individual. It is this self-presencing which, now and then, will advice us to break the voluntary action through an automatism which can be no less detrimental than it is convenient. Many people in fact relinquish the conscious state and self-presencing, and accordingly fall into sheer machine-like behaviour, leading them to discover in automatism the secret of an easy and useless life. The intelligent man, by contrast, must always allow his reason’s critique to occupy the pre-eminent place which it is rightfully entitled to. That critique will occasionally counsel him to engage in a salutary rebellion against automatism elevated into the guiding norm of both our personal and social conduct. By means of such healthy rebellion to it, the critical reason will push our conduct towards new and demanding roads which ultimately lead us to our own progress.
last_phrase: In conclusion, while "acting naturally" may serve as a means to a less strenuous voluntary action, it should not be mistaken as an end in itself. The conscious individual must always strive for self-presencing and engage in healthy rebellion against the machine-like behavior of automatism. By exercising critical judgment and striving for self-perfection, one can achieve their loftiest goals and avoid falling into the trap of easy and useless living. Therefore, let us use the method outlined in this book to aid our actions and strive for progress on new and demanding roads.
